availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Parker (Hopkins and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Hopkins and Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. North Carolina native. Married to Isabella Gooch Parker. Father of Willis Parker, Eli Thomas Parker, Rufus Parker, Joel Parker, and Joseph Parker. Married to Delia Ruby Parker in Webster County, Kentucky, on March 1, 1865. Farmer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 126B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 614.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 486A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, District 4, p. 232B-233A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (185201910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994039, Hopkins County Births.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Webster County Marriages, Film #000565876.
